image.altText: A large green toll shop is docked in the port of Burnie, while workers with machinery unload it.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's port operator is facing problems at both ends of the state with ageing infrastructure, including some over 100 years old, leading to safety concerns and costly upgrades.

title.children: Tasmania is a state reliant on shipping, but outdated wharf infrastructure is causing challenges

image.altText: Tom Craig after being released from police custody in Paris.

props.synopsis: Paris public prosecutor's office confirms a 28-year-old Australian was arrested after being seen by police attempting to buy the illicit substance.

title.children: 'I've embarrassed you all': Australian hockey player Tom Craig arrested in Paris trying to buy cocaine

image.altText: Two drivers using a long implement to drill into a coral reef colony underwater

props.synopsis: Scientists have been able to look at corals like tree rings to work out how warm the Coral Sea has been each summer across four centuries. They say the results reveal an alarmingly urgent need to turn around the trajectory of climate change.

title.children: Coral Sea's hottest summer in 400 years puts Great Barrier Reef on verge of 'in danger' status again

image.altText: Keegan Palmer bits on his Olympic gold medal at Paris Games.

props.synopsis: In the space of only a few hours, Australia adds three gold medals to its Paris haul, as skateboarder Keegan Palmer, sailor Matt Wearn and the men's team pursuit quartet all top the podium. Follow live.

title.children: Australia equals its highest gold medal tally in Olympic history after triple treat, as Kennedy looks to join the Paris party

image.altText: A row of high rise buildings set in front of a blue sky.

props.synopsis: Profits of Australia's top 200 listed companies are expected to shrink for the 2024 financial year, heading for their second consecutive year of earnings contraction.

title.children: Corporate reporting season is set to be a 'negative story for earnings growth'

image.altText: Separate close-up headshots of Tim Walz and JD Vance.

props.synopsis: Tim Walz, a conservative-looking progressive, has a backstory that is so quintessentially small-town America, it feels almost made up.

title.children: The 'hillbilly' vs the hunter: How America's VP candidates will battle for the heartland

image.altText: a large ferry with red livery in the sea.

props.synopsis: The ongoing saga of Tasmania's new ferries has charted yet another course, with it being revealed the bigger ships won't be able to operate at full capacity because the ships will sit too low at their temporary berth.

title.children: The new Spirit of Tasmania ferries unable to run at full capacity for years due to port upgrade delay

image.altText: Gun seized by Tasmania Police

props.synopsis: A sub-machine gun, double-barrel 12-gauge shotgun and a homemade weapon are among the firearms seized by Tasmania Police this past month.

title.children: Submachine gun fired in hotel room among dozens of firearms seized in Tasmania

props.synopsis: Mounting scandals involving Buddhist monks are eroding public faith in a key pillar of Thai society.

title.children: Thailand's monks keep committing crimes involving drugs, corruption, and even murder

image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank governor's public declaration was intended to remove any expectation of rate relief for the remainder of this year. It's a reality check that landed with a thud.

title.children: The Reserve Bank governor has delivered a reality check on rates. It landed with a thud

image.altText: David Lindenmayer

props.synopsis: Though logging in Victoria has officially ended, the powerful interests behind it have set up a new organisation to continue the industry, which experts say amounts to greenwashing.

title.children: 'Greenwashing on steroids': Logging bosses team up to form new 'healthy forests' group

image.altText: A childhood educator sitting at a table with several young kids

props.synopsis: The federal government has announced it will fund a 15 per cent wage increase for early childhood education workers, tied to a commitment from childcare centres to limit fee increases.

title.children: 'It's not babysitting': Early childhood educators set for bumper wage increase

image.altText: Close up head shot of Elizabeth Taylor on a white backdrop

props.synopsis: After garnering a nomination for best documentary at this year's Cannes Film Festival, The Lost Tapes allows audiences a look into Taylor's remarkable life in her own words.

title.children: Elizabeth Taylor reflects on her 'horrendous mistakes' and run-in with the Vatican in new documentary

image.altText: A woman stands by a sink in a bathroom.

props.synopsis: Jenna Lovell's hypermobile spectrum disorder means turning taps and handles can be impossible, but her landlord refused to replace the taps in her home. In Tasmania, she had no recourse other than an anti-discrimination complaint.

title.children: Jenna's landlord refused to make a $200 change so she could access water — until she sent a legal letter

image.altText: Three small buildings reduced to rubble.

props.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin has met with his top defence and security officials to discuss what he called the "indiscriminate shelling of civilian buildings", with Ukrainian officials yet to comment.

title.children: Vladimir Putin accuses Ukraine of 'large-scale provocation' in Russia's Kursk region

image.altText: Matt Wearn holds the Australian flag as he celebrates winning gold.

props.synopsis: In a dramatic finish, Matt Wearn was initially just minutes from collecting gold when the final was called off due to failing wind and then re-run 30 minutes later.

title.children: Aussie super sailor Matt Wearn becomes first back-to-back Olympic champion in men's dinghy

image.altText: Keegan Palmer holds his skateboard above his head after winning gold.

props.synopsis: Australian skateboard king Keegan Palmer achieves the prodigious feat of spinning and twisting his way to his second Olympic gold medal at the age of just 21.

title.children: 'Speechless' Keegan Palmer calls Arisa Trew an inspiration after pulling off golden skateboard double

image.altText: Cyclists

props.synopsis: In Tokyo, Australia was embarrassed and bloodied by faulty handlebars. Just three short years later at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, the Aussies are back on top.

title.children: 'To hell and back': How Australia's team pursuit squad returned to the summit of track cycling

image.altText: Rhydian Cowley and Jemima Montag, arm in arm, holding Australian flags over their heads, in front of the Eiffel Tower

props.synopsis: Australian duo duo Jemima Montag and Rhydian Cowley create their own slice of Olympic history, claiming bronze in the inaugural Olympic marathon race walk in Paris.

title.children: Montag, Cowley snare bronze in marathon walk relay

image.altText: Peter Bol near the front of the field as they round the bend in his 800-metre heat at the Paris Olympics.

props.synopsis: Australian middle-distance star Peter Bol insists he has nothing to answer for after a potentially damaging screenshot on his mobile phone was made public in a separate anti-doping case.

title.children: 'I've got nothing to answer for': Peter Bol dismisses WADA claims as Olympic campaign begins

image.altText: Female basketball player Alanna Smith shoots the ball with one hand, with two defenders around her trying to block

props.synopsis: For the first time since 2012, the Australian Opals are into the Olympic semifinals after defeating Serbia.

title.children: Opals guaranteed to play for a medal after quarterfinal win over Serbia

image.altText: Muhammad Yunus waves at the camera with a small smile on his face

props.synopsis: The Nobel laureate says he wants to hold fresh elections in "a few months" in Bangladesh.

title.children: 'Get ready to build the country': Muhammad Yunus rallies Bangladesh ahead of taking lead of interim government

image.altText: The Israeli Iron Dome air defence system fires to intercept an attack, shown in the night sky with streaks of light.

props.synopsis: Iran and its Lebanon-based proxy Hezbollah have vowed retaliation against Israel after senior Hamas and Hezbollah figures were killed. This is what we know about the weapons they have.

title.children: As tensions in the Middle East escalate, here's what we know about Hezbollah and Iran's weapons

image.altText: A red Crowdstrike logo on a phone in the foreground, and the Microsoft Blue Screen of Death in the background

props.synopsis: CrowdStrike releases its analysis of last month's global IT outage, revealing an "embarrassing" mistake experts say first-year programming students are taught how to avoid.

title.children: CrowdStrike reveals root cause of global outage, and it's a mistake first-year programming students learn about

image.altText: a large group of workers in high-vis shirts gathered at a park. CFMEU branding can be seen in the background

props.synopsis: Court documents reveal the Fair Work Commission has fined the CFMEU and its members more than 2,600 times in 21 years.

title.children: Fair Work says CFMEU broke the law thousands of times, costing members millions

image.altText: Denmark's Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen in a blue dress.

props.synopsis: The man who assaulted Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen was sentenced to four months in jail.

title.children: Polish man who assaulted Denmark's prime minister sentenced, set to be deported

image.altText: Tim Walz speaks at a podium in front of a large tractor and a US flag.

props.synopsis: Nobody ever even considered the possibility that Kamala Harris's running mate would be anything but white and male. How will Tim Walz ever be quite sure that he clinched the VP nomination on merit?

title.children: Is Tim Walz really white? Is he really male? Did he sleep his way to the top? The internet is where things get wild for diversity hires

image.altText: a crowd of thai politicians do a thumbs-up gesture

props.synopsis: Thailand's Constitutional Court has ruled to dissolve the opposition Move Forward Party (MFP). Here's why it is unlikely to signal the end of the popular group.

title.children: Thai court dissolves progressive Move Forward Party, orders 10-year ban on executives

image.altText: Don Farrell wearing a suit and tie looks off into the distance.

props.synopsis: The federal government is close to finalising its plan for broad changes to election laws, including spending limits, donation limits and truth standards for political ads.

title.children: As Labor inches closer to electoral reform, a 'consensus' approach looks far from certain

image.altText: A group of three Olympic medals - with silver, gold and bronze left to right - are shown against a dark background.

props.synopsis: Keep up with how many medals Aussie athletes have won today — and where Australia sits on the leaderboard.

title.children: Here are the medal standings for day 12 of the Olympic Games

image.altText: P8 Poseidon

props.synopsis: The Australian Defence Force has announced that it will join another military drill in the contested waters of the South China Sea, where there have been a series of increasingly dangerous confrontations between China and the Philippines.

title.children: Australia joins defence exercise in contested South China Sea after Philippines deal with China to ease tensions

image.altText: A hole shows where the panel was very close to where passengers sat

props.synopsis: Workers from the embattled airplane company told the US transport safety authority a lack of accountability led to safety issues such as those on the Alaska Airlines plane where a cabin door was missing four bolts and blew out mid-flight.

title.children: 'Garbage' safety culture at Boeing to blame for cabin door blowout mid-flight, watchdog hears

image.altText: A black sports car on the back of a tow truck

props.synopsis: Two men laundered more than $60 million using a scheme involving huge wads of cash, bank accounts and cryptocurrency, a Victorian court is told.

title.children: Men face deportation after being jailed over 'eye-watering' money laundering scam

image.altText: A ban crouches on a branch of the historic banyan tree, which has been charred and b

props.synopsis: Despite being charred and blackened, the 151-year-old banyan tree has revived with the help of arborists and conservationists.

title.children: Lahaina almost lost their oldest banyan tree to wildfires. Here's how they're bringing it back to life
